message.body: Hello Mugs!
Hi, good morning! How is your day so far?
Absolutely fantastic! How are you? What are you up to?
That's wonderful! I'm great, I took a long bike ride this morning and now I am meeting friends for lunch. So far so good!
Wow! Sounds pretty healthy. Are you a student then? I am.
Yeah I am, out for the summer..what are you studying?
Japanese Japanese Japanese Japanese Japanese and more
Hbu?
So much Japanese! I'm studying archeology. Are you taking summer classes?
Yes. I've been studying Japanese elementary school through highschool and I still believe the best way to retain a language is to immerse yourself
what makes you interested in archaeology?
I'm interested in the function of social inequality, and material evidence of it in ancient cultures.
So are you in Japan now?
Oh haha I wish. Naw I vagabond the blast radius of our nation's capital. If you are interested in social inequality, have you heard of the pride parade?
Hmmm which pride is that?
hahaha that would be gay pride. It's going to be this weekend. I am a strong advocate for economic freedom and social tolerance.
But maybe that's my white male cis-scum privilege speaking.
Do you participate in activism for causes in the social studies you are in?
Oh, ok I'm familiar with that one. My only issue with gay pride is that I don't believe in a gender binary, and so I feel like emphasizing sexuality creates imaginary divisions.
I'm sorry; I am a little confused by your terminology. Could you define your use of gender binary? Do you think the normalization of the LGBT community would be
worse or the same as the status quo for humanity?
I hate strawmanning so I like things to be well defined n:]
I just don't think that sexuality is polarized. I have had relationships with men and women and neither takes precedence over the other. I don't see it as better or worse.
Ahhh I see a Kinsey scale kind of deal. That's a pretty cool perspective because it removes gender bias from the equation. A lot of people live in the extremes
so that would help to understand the current paradigm. While I do think it may not immediately address the issue of gender bias, moving toward an LGBT tolerant
community (I hope) would be closer toward a scalar view of sexuality, instead of a polar one
Or sticking with heteronormality
I was thinking more like Judith Butler--that gender itself is a performance--but yeah, the Kinsey scale is appropriate.
I'm absolutely for tolerance, and I hope the efforts that people are making in this realm take society in that direction.
